creator: White, Thomas, 1830-1888. (editor)
Macpherson, David Lewis, 1818-1896. (preface)
Canada. Department of the Interior (author)
description: White, Thomas: 1830-1888. Born and educated in Montreal; journalist; founded and operated Peterborough Review, 1853-1860; founded Hamilton Spectator, 1864; immigration agent in England for Canada, 1869; assumed control of Montreal Gazette, 1870; elected to House of Commons, 1878-1888; Minister of the Interior, 1885-1888 and thus responsible for reorganizing government of North West Territories after the second Riel Rebellion (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Macpherson, David Lewis: 1818-1896. // Half title: "La rébellion du nord-ouest." For English version see Peel 1559. Text in double columns. A defence of the Conservative government.
subject: Rebellions and Regimental Histories--Saskatchewan Rebellion
Canada--Politics and government
Riel Rebellion, 1885
Riel, Rébellion de, 1885
title: Faits pour le peuple: la Rébellion du nord-ouest: la question des métis et leur traitement par le gouvernement
